biography: Mikael, a celebrated alumnus of Kurk Golf, is known for his meticulous approach to the game and his calm demeanor under pressure. Though seemingly retired from Hector Trophée events, his impact on the sport remains significant.

Mikael has participated once in past Hector Trophée events. While the coveted Hector Trophée and the Victor Trophy have eluded him, his presence was always noted by his peers. His strategic mind and precise execution made him a formidable opponent in any format, be it individual play or as part of a pair.
While Mikael is not scheduled to participate in Hector Trophée 2025, the possibility of a last-minute entry always looms, much to the excitement of his fans and fellow competitors.
